mergeSSAMaps

public Pair<Pair<SymbolicFormula,SymbolicFormula>,SSAMap> mergeSSAMaps(SSAMap ssa1,
                                                                       SSAMap ssa2,
                                                                       boolean absoluteSSAIndices)
Description copied from interface: SymbolicFormulaManager
builds a formula that represents the necessary variable assignments to "merge" the two ssa maps. That is, for every variable X that has two different ssa indices i and j in the maps, creates a new formula (X_k = X_i) | (X_k = X_j), where k is a fresh ssa index. Returns the formula described above, plus a new SSAMap that is the merge of the two.

Specified by:
mergeSSAMaps in interface SymbolicFormulaManager
Parameters:
ssa1 - an SSAMap
ssa2 - an SSAMap
absoluteSSAIndices - if true, use a unique index for each ssa variable, instead of keeping a separate index for each var
Returns:
A pair (SymbolicFormula, SSAMap)

instantiate

public SymbolicFormula instantiate(SymbolicFormula f,
                                   SSAMap ssa)
Description copied from interface: SymbolicFormulaManager
Given a formula that uses "generic" variables, returns the corresponding one that "instantiates" such variables according to the given SSA map. This is used by AbstractFormulaManager.toConcrete()

Specified by:
instantiate in interface SymbolicFormulaManager
Parameters:
f - the generic SymbolicFormula to instantiate
ssa - the SSAMap to use
Returns:
a copy of f in which every "generic" variable is replaced by the corresponding "SSA instance"

makeFalse

public SymbolicFormula makeFalse()
Specified by:
makeFalse in interface SymbolicFormulaManager
Returns:
a SymbolicFormula representing logical falsity

shift

public Pair<SymbolicFormula,SSAMap> shift(SymbolicFormula f,
                                          SSAMap ssa)
Description copied from interface: SymbolicFormulaManager
"shifts" forward all the variables in the formula f, of the amount given by the input ssa. That is, variables x with index 1 in f will be replaced by variables with index ssa.getIndex(x), vars with index 2 by vars with index ssa.getIndex(x)+1, and so on. Returns the new formula and the ssa map with the final index for each variable

Specified by:
shift in interface SymbolicFormulaManager
Parameters:
f - the SymbolicFormula to shift
ssa - the SSAMap to use for shifting
Returns:
the shifted formula and the new SSA map
